Dear Ms. Shell:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violation identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The corrective
action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (517) 899-6024.
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a youth
on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff slapped a youth in the face.
Investigation Interviews:
On 12/18/24 Complainant reported that Staff 1 slapped Youth A
on that date, as retaliation from Youth A brushing up against their
leg. Staff 1 was terminated from employment. Youth A had a red
handprint on the right side of her face.
Youth A was observed face-to-face at the facility by DCWL on
12/23/24. No marks were observed. Youth A did not want to talk
about the incident at that time. On 1/3/25 a face-to-face interview
with Youth A occurred at the facility in collaboration with MDHHS
Worker. Youth A reported that on 12/18/24 she kneeled on a chair
that Staff 1 had her foot on. Staff 1 kept telling Youth A to get up.
Youth A pushed on Staff 1. Staff 1 slapped Youth A in the face.
Staff 2 stopped Youth A from picking up the chair and throwing it
at Staff 1. Youth A reported there were no other staff or youth on
the wing at the time. Youth A went to the nurse after the incident,
where a red mark was observed on her cheek.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 12/23/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 stated that she saw
Staff 1 slap Youth A in the face on 12/18/24. Prior to that, Youth A
was upset as she did not want Staff 1 on the unit. Staff 1 could not
leave, as Youth A was required to have two staff with her at all
times. A supervisor had been called to address the issue and was
on their way. Youth A had been given permission by a supervisor
to move her clothing into another room on the unit to use it as a
closet. Staff 1 stood in the door and did not allow Youth A to go
into the room with her belongings. Staff 2 swapped positions with
Staff 1 and allowed Youth A to straighten her belongings. Youth A
2

then went to a chair and stood on it, trying to pull things down from
the ceiling. Staff 2 redirected Youth A. Youth A sat in another
chair, where Staff 1 had her foot propped. Youth A asked Staff 1
to move her leg several times. Staff 1 did not move. Youth A then
nudged Staff 1’s leg. Staff 1 reacted by slapping Youth A in the
face. Youth A then tried to pick up a chair to throw at Staff 1. Staff
2 held the chair and stopped Youth A from throwing it. Staff 2
observed Staff 1 taking off her jacket as if she were about to fight.
Additional staff arrived on the unit and Staff 1 was prompted to
leave. Staff 1 began walking towards the door. Then Youth A said
something to Staff 1 and she turned around and walked back in
Youth A’s direction. Staff 1 was prompted to leave again and
walked off the unit.
Staff 1 was interviewed by phone on 1/16/25 by DCWL. Staff 1
reported she worked with Youth A on 12/17/24. Youth A had a
difficult day and made many threats toward Staff 1. Youth A
threatened to stab staff with a pen, bit staff, punched staff, and
jumped at them as if she were going to punch them. Youth A
stood on chairs and pulled down ceiling tiles. Youth A threatened
to throw the chair at Staff 1, then picked up the chair and banged
on the walls and windows with it. Staff 1 stated she tried to
verbally deescalate Youth A and offered to take her to the calming
room. But Youth A did not respond. Staff 1 stated she was not
given a walkie and could not call for assistance. Staff 1 used her
personal cell phone to call the manager, who came to the unit to
relieve her. The next day, 12/18/24, Staff 1 arrived on shift and
found that she was assigned to work with Youth A again. When
she entered the unit, Youth A said, “why the f*** are you back here
again?” Youth A began acting out by tearing up the bathroom in
the laundry area and standing on furniture attempting to tear the
ceiling down. Staff 1 stated she tried to verbally deescalate Youth
A, without much success. Staff 1 noted that Youth A was on
increased supervision and had to have two staff at all times. Youth
A was also not to be left alone in her room, or any room, due to
suicidal ideation. Youth A was using a vacant room as a closet
and asked to go in it. When she did, Staff 1 stood at the doorway.
Youth A became upset because Staff 1 would not close the door
and allow Youth A to be in the closet alone. Staff 2 offered to
switch out. Youth A stated, “get this b**** (Staff 1) off the wing, or
I’m about to do something crazy”. Youth A then stood on a chair
and pulled some ceiling tiles down. Staff 1 put her foot on the
other chair in the room to keep Youth A from picking it up and
using it as a weapon. Youth A pushed on Staff 1’s leg, then
pushed on her shoulder. Staff 1 slapped Youth A’s cheek. Staff 1
stated it was not planned, or meant to hurt Youth A. It was pure
3

reflex from Youth A pushing her shoulder near her own face. Staff
1 then backed away and Staff 2 put herself in front of Youth A.
Staff 2 had already called for assistance and they arrived just after
the slap occurred. Staff 1 denied intentionally agitating Youth A or
indicating she was willing to fight. Staff 1 stated she left the unit
once Youth A was blocked by staff and it was safe to do so.
Reflecting on the incident, Staff 1 was unsure why she was placed
on the unit with Youth A for her shift, after the previous day had
been so difficult. Staff 1 stated the kids on this program are
relentless with attacking staff, throwing things, spitting, and
constantly having a “clear” called. Staff 1 stated the youth need
more consequences for their behaviors. Youth know that staff
cannot do anything to stop their behavior, other than verbal
redirection. Youth also know they can assault staff without
consequence, as the youth do not care about having privileges
removed.
Video Review:
Staff 1 put her foot on a chair. Youth A approached and kneeled
on chair. Staff 2 approached, talking with Youth A. Youth A
pushed Staff 1’s leg with her hand. Staff 1 took her left hand and
slapped Youth A on her right cheek. Youth A picked up the chair.
Staff 2 got between them and walked away with Youth A and the
chair. Staff 1 continued talking, making gestures, and walked back
towards Youth A. Youth A was standing with Staff 2. Staff 2 had
their arm around Youth A in a protective way, not restraining.
Youth A was not attempting to move. Staff 1 continued making
gestures and talking, then removed her jacket and took a fighting
stance. Additional staff came on the unit and removed the chair.
Youth A charged at Staff 1 and was blocked by staff. Staff 1’s
body language suggested she was yelling, although there was no
audio. Staff 1 then picked up her jacket from the floor and left the
unit.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident report dated 12/17/24, authored by Staff 2. Youth
A asked Staff 2 to contact a supervisor. Staff 2 called for a
supervisor, who stated they would be there shortly. Youth A
responded “she (supervisor) got 5 minutes, or I am going to
do something crazy to her (Staff 1)”. Youth A took a cup of
water to her room; Staff 2 was able to retrieve the cup.
Youth A stood on a chair and unscrewed light bulbs from
the ceiling. Staff 2 was able to get Youth A off the chair and
retrieve the light bulbs. Staff 1 was standing with her foot
on a chair. Youth A then told Staff 1 to move and brushed
up against Staff 1’s leg. Staff 1 asked Youth A to stop
4

touching her. Youth A then pushed Staff 1. Staff 1 slapped
Youth A. Additional staff were called to the unit. Staff 1 took
her jacket off and was in a fighting stance and was calling
Youth A a “b****”. Staff 1 stated, I’m about to beat this b****
ass.” Staff 1 was told to leave the unit and began to leave.
Youth A called for Staff 1 and said, “come back here”. Staff
1 turned around and went back toward the unit, but
additional staff arrived and directed Staff 1 out. Youth A
was assessed by the nurse.
• Nursing note dated 12/17/2024, authored by Staff 3. The
note stated Youth A was seen after reportedly being hit by
staff. Youth A’s face was red on the right side. Youth A
stated she was in pain and was provided over the counter
pain reliever.
• Human Resources file for Staff 1:
o Completed orientation training from 11/15/24 to
11/19/24 and Crisis Prevention Institute training on
11/20/24 and 11/21/24.
o Staff 1 did not have any prior disciplinary action.
o Staff 1 was terminated on 12/18/24.
Analysis A violation was found based on video and interviews. It was
determined Staff 1 slapped Youth A in the face. After the incident,
Staff 1 did not remove herself from the situation immediately and
physically appeared to be ready to engage in a fight with Youth A.
CONSULTATION:
The agency was advised that scheduling staff on back-to-back
shifts with youth they have had altercations with, is not best
practice. The agency reported they generally keep staff and youth
separated that do not interact well. However, there are times when
the schedule does not allow this. Especially in the case of Youth
A, where she is required to be at a 2:1 ratio. The agency will
continue to be cognizant of these concerns.
Conclusion REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED

Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or discriminatory
language including negative references to a youth’s background
or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats, ridicule, or
humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff used derogatory language towards youth.
Investigation Documents Reviewed:
• Incident report dated 12/17/24, authored by Staff 2. Staff 1
was standing with her foot on a chair. Youth A then told
Staff 1 to move and brushed up against Staff 1’s leg. Staff 1
asked Youth A to stop touching her. Youth A then pushed
Staff 1. Staff 1 slapped Youth A. Additional staff were called
to the unit. Staff 1 took her jacket off and was in a fighting
stance and was calling Youth A a “b****”. Staff 1 stated, I’m
about to beat this b**** ass.” Staff 1 was told to leave the
unit and began to leave. Youth A called for Staff 1 and said,
“come back here”. Staff 1 turned around and went back
toward the unit, but additional staff arrived and directed
Staff 1 out. Youth A was assessed by the nurse.
Analysis A violation was found based on the incident report authored by
Staff 2, stating that Staff 1 used derogatory language toward
Youth A.
Conclusion VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
6

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and a corrective action plan is required. Per Special
Investigation 2024SIC0000139, a second provisional license is recommended.
